title: Implementing ELK Centralized log, zipkin in microservices spring boot 3 Advance Topic Hindi video 25
description:
#spring #springboot #springboottutorial #api #restapis #javaprogramming #java #javatutorial #microservicesarchitecture #microservice #microservicestutorial #elk #elasticsearch #logstash #kibana #sleuth #zipkin 

Tech used with Spring boot 3 and jdk 17
1. Zipkin ( 3.0.5 ) latest
https://zipkin.io/pages/quickstart.html
2. Elastic search
https://www.elastic.co/downloads/elasticsearch
3. Kibana UI 
https://www.elastic.co/downloads/kibana
4. Logstash
https://www.elastic.co/downloads/logstash

In this video we have implemented ELK (elastic search, logstash, kibana console) and sleuth and zipkin in our microservices.

Main reason is that we want to enable tracing and logging in our microservice for better Exception handling.

This is an advance topic.

Commands
elasticsearch-reset-password -u elastic -i
for elastic search password reset 

.\bin\logstash -f .\config\logstash.conf
to start logstach

Ports
kibana : 5601
elastice search : 9200
zipkin : 9411


Time Stamps
00:00 Introduction
00:35 Sleuth, Zipkin, Elk overview
01:42 Why do we need ELk or centralized logging
04:28 Special message for all of you
05:09 Downloading zipkin (link in desc)
06:37 Adding dependencies in Microservice for Tracing
08:17 Error java.lang.unsupportedclassversionerror and how to fix it.
09:32 Apache zookeeper error (the system cannot find the path specified) and fixing it.
10:39 Starting Zipkin server
11:27 Making logs folder and adding it in microservices and configuring it for logs generation.
12:10 Adding actuator dependency.
15:08 Enabling tracing management.tracing.sampling.probability = 1.0 and adding in application.properties
17:21 Generating logs and checking on zipkin
23:29 Starting with ELK ( downloading and installing and setting up )
26:24 Resetting elastic search password for elastic user.
27:14 Testing elastic search
30:10 Configure Elastic to get started and configuring it.
30:33 Creating enrollment token for elastic search
31:55 Getting started with kibana.
32:56 Starting logstash.

Thank you (basic microservice architecture is finished, now we will start Angular)

title: Implementing Apache Kafka in microservices confirmation mails Advance Topic, Hindi video 24
description:
#spring #springboot #springboottutorial #api #restapis #javaprogramming #java #javatutorial #microservicesarchitecture #microservice #microservicestutorial #kafka #apachekafka 

In this video we have implemented producer and consumer architecture using apache Kafka for handling bulk real time requests and sending mails in our microservices.

This is an advance topic.

Commands
.\bin\windows\kafka-server-start.bat .\config\server.properties
.\bin\windows\zookeeper-server-start.bat .\config\zookeeper.properties

Time Stamps
00:00 Topic Introduction
00:30 Why do we required apache Kafka in this microservice, discussing about problems we are facing in our microservice.
03:07 What Kafka exactly used for?
05:02 Taking about zookeeper and Kafka server, how to install that
08:07 Adding Kafka and required dependency to get started in our microservice
09:47 Adding producer service implementation logic class
13:07 Adding Kafka configuration in application.properties
19:27 Adding consumer service implementation logic class
23:47 Exception i.e No group.id found in consumer config, container properties, or @KafkaListener annotation; a goup.id is required when group management is used and handling this and testing
27:27 springframework.messaging.converter.MessageConversionException: cannot convert from [java.lang.String] to [com.ecom.common...] for generic message and handling it, then testing it.
